elements.title: Reaper
elements.contents: ... that the first painting (pictured) in Vincent van Gogh's 1889 series Reaper may have been gifted to his contemporary artist Paul Gauguin?

elements.title: Harold A. Littledale
elements.contents: ... that Harold A. Littledale went undercover as a prisoner for his Pulitzer Prize–winning investigation into the New Jersey prison system?

elements.title: The Canadian Brothers
elements.contents: ... that after it bombed in Canada, John Richardson removed anti-American passages from The Canadian Brothers to publish it in New York?

elements.title: Tandiono Manu
elements.contents: ... that Tandiono Manu worked in a tax office, took part in guerrilla warfare and then became Minister of Agriculture?

elements.title: 1912 Army Cadets football team
elements.contents: ... that a future president of the United States played halfback for the 1912 Army Cadets football team?

elements.title: Peter Pharoah
elements.contents: ... that the clinical trials of British scientist Peter Pharoah helped eradicate congenital iodine deficiency syndrome (cretinism) in Papua New Guinea?

elements.title: Coronet Theatre
elements.contents: ... that in 1959, the new owner of the Coronet Theatre wanted to rename the theater after his favorite playwright, Eugene O'Neill, whose widow objected?

elements.title: Li Jiaqi
elements.contents: ... that China's "lipstick king", Li Jiaqi, once sold 15,000 lipsticks in five minutes in a faceoff against Alibaba Group's CEO?
